scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
There is no Member State that includes CPOV in their national catalogue with the National Interoperability Framework (NIF) aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
The CPOV eases the description and publication of datasets including information of different public organisations, their services and responsibilities. These descriptions are done using human and redeable formats which ease the reusability and the information exchange across-borders. 

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

5-star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
The Semantic Interoperability Community (SEMIC) has established Working Groups. These Working Groups are open to the participation of everyone interested in semantic solutions working for public administrations in the Member States or in EU institutions.

SEMIC working groups:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/semantic-interoperability-community-semic/about

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
​The Semantic Interoperability Community (SEMIC) develops solutions to help European public administrations perform seamless and meaningful cross-border and cross-domain data exchanges. They develop semantic specifications and interoperability solutions under the ISA² Programme. When a new solution release is finished, it is submitted for a public review with a minimum period of four weeks.

Specification development process by the ISA Programme:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/semantic-interoperability-community-semic/document/description-change-management-release-and-publication-process-structural-metadata-specifications

Detailed document ISA Programme:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/sites/default/files/document/2016-10/description_of_a_change_management_release_and_publication_process_for_structural_metadata_specifications_developed_by_the_isa_progr.pdf

statement:
CPOV is publicly available for its use and implementation. Moreover, it is available for everyone to study with no cost on Joinup webpage.

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
All solutions developed in ISA² Programme are under ISA Open Metadata Licence which is perpetual, royalty-free and non-exclusive license to Use and re-Use the Works.

ISA open metadata license:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/licence/isa-open-metadata-licence-v11

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The Core Public Organisation Vocabulary was released in December 2016. Its first aspiration was to become a common data model for describing public organisations in the European Union. So, CPOV is mature enough for its use in the development of products and services.

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
Although the Core Public Organisation Vocabulary is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services, it does not have a good market acceptance because it has not been integrated with any official solution, it has only been tested on pilots.

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
Although the Core Public Organisation Vocabulary does not have a good market acceptance, it proportionates innovative benefits such as facilitate information sharing, facilitate the development of common information systems, and cross-border information exchange.

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

criterion_description: The specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
As it happens with all the e-Government Vocabularies, it has the SEMIC action from the ISA2 as responsible for the maintenance of the development. Additionally, there's a post on W3C in open government community group that talks about the specification.

CPOV page on Joinup: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

CPOV post in W3C:
https://www.w3.org/community/opengov/2016/02/21/core-public-organisation-vocabulary/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
The main purpose of CPOV is to provide a reusable data model for describing public organisations in the European Union. It manages a public portfolio that facilitates the discovery of which public authorities and departments are responsible for given areas of the public task. So, it facilitates the visibility of administrative rules.

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the comprehensibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
The main purpose of CPOV is to provide a reusable data model for describing public organisations in the European Union. The CPOV helps to identify where responsibilities and functions are duplicated or overlapped. So, it helps to comprehend the administrative rules and data of public administration.

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
The adoption of CPOV as a data model does not hamper the scalability of systems. The use of existing data models for the development of common information systems facilitates the development of those systems and improves their interoperability.
 
CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
The Core Public Organisation Vocabulary facilitates information sharing between governments, businesses, and citizens. The CPOV allows managing a cross-border repository of public services and organisations. So, it fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services.

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
The Core Public Organisation Vocabulary facilitates the process for institutions publishing data about public organisations. This Core Vocabulary fosters interoperability and impacts positively on the development of eGovernment.

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

statement:
Core Public Organisation Vocabulary facilitates the information sharing. It enables G2G (Government-to-Government), G2B (Government-to-Business) and G2C (Government-to-Citizen) information sharing.

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement:
The Core Public Organisation Vocabulary fosters the delivery of multilingual services in European public institutions. In CPOV, the values of all properties with a data type “Literal” may exist in multiple languages. 

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
The Core Public Organisation Vocabulary facilitates the information sharing between governments, business and citizens. So, it reduces the administrative burden by facilitating the use of digital data.

criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement: After carrying out information retrieval, no document or study has been found assessing the CPOV in terms of efficiency or effectiveness.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
CPOV is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, CPOV can define the interoperability aspects of the "Core Data Model" and "Data" ABBs of the EIRA Semantic View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
As a vocabulary, the implementation of CPOV can be tested using methods like SHACL shapes and using semantic reasoners to ensure that the implementation is well-formed. These validation mechanisms can be used with open source tools or lite versions of tools like GrapghDB or Protégé.

SHACL validation: 
https://graphdb.ontotext.com/documentation/free/shacl-validation.html#what-is-shacl-validation

Semantic Reasoners List: 
http://owl.cs.manchester.ac.uk/tools/list-of-reasoners/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of CPOV is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
CPOV defines a data model for describing public organisations in the European Union. The Core Public Organisation Vocabulary addresses specific needs of businesses, public administrations and citizens across the European Union.

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
The definition of the specification justifies this criterion. The Core Public Organisation Vocabulary (CPOV) provides a common data model for describing public organisations in the European Union.

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
The CPOV eases the description and publication of datasets including information of different public organisations, their services and responsibilities. These descriptions are done using human and redeable formats which ease the reusability and the information exchange across-borders. 

CPOV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary
